name: Carlton Hotel Blanchardstown

reviews.text: Don't be fooled by the location in the tilte of this Hotel - its about 5-6 miles from Blanchardstown, situated in a different suburb of Dublin, Tyrrellstown! Its akin to Ryanair saying they fly to Paris & Barcelona.
reviews.title: The Carlton (nowhere near) Blanchardstown

reviews.text: When we eventually found the hotel, we met friendly staff and enjoyed a good sized clean room with modern decor. The food was good quality (evening meal and breakfast) and the Bar was well stocked, although €2.90 for a mineral is too expensive even for a hotel in this day and age. Overall we enjoyed our short stay, but were irate when we phoned the Hotel from Blanchardstown to hear them tell us "its not actually in Blanchardstown".
reviews.title: Pleasently surprised and excellent value

reviews.text: I stayed here by chance for one night and was more than pleasantly surprised. Good sized, modern decorated room with above average linen and room amenities. I understand it's recently been acquired by Clarion so that may explain the only irritation of an empty mini-bar, new business caution no doubt - a bottle of water in the room would have fixed this. Service in general was good and a few negatives can be forgiven on balance when the excellent room rate was taken to account. To improve a little more customer awareness/staff training is needed. For example unable to charge items to room as credit card was not taken at check-in, a slight annoyance as check-in staff didn't ask! On the same note, a customer obviously struggling with luggage should be offered assistance, again a lack of customer awareness as none offered.
reviews.title: Worst service ever!

reviews.text: On the plus side, dinner was good, quality and value, both above expectations. Breakfast too was good offering the standard Irish hotel breakfast buffet - nothing exceptional but again above the average for choice and quality.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: Overall the service matched the room rate and value for money it was more than adequate and happy to recommend.
reviews.title: Emergency flight cancelled hotel - excellent

reviews.text: We had a fantastic stay in this hotel before kids returned to school, staff were very friendly with the kids and made their stay all the more enjoyable.
reviews.title: Family break with the kids
Comfort, style and friendliness
reviews.text: We had adjoining rooms which gave us ample space for everyone having a large family makes it difficult for us to accommodate everyone together.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Over all a very memorable stay, my daughter's thought it was a castle :-)
reviews.title: Definitely not worthy of four stars

reviews.text: I have stayed in this hotel a few times and never wrote a review on it. The hotel is a great place to stay. Its very plush and a lot of though was put into the decor. The hotel is based on the design of time. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The food is very good. Its just over a five minute drive to Blanchardstown Shopping Centre. Very close proximity to the airport. The staff are very helpful and friendly and this always seems consistent. Two thumbs up :)
reviews.title: What a lovely hotel with excellent staff.

reviews.text: Really wasnt impressed by this hotel, the receptionist didnt have a record of our reservation on arrival as she hadnt got round to printing them off, when we got up to our room which was supposed to be a deluxe double the number had fallen off the door the lock was broken on the bathroom the soap rack over the bath was broken. The bed was small. I was really disappointed with this hotel for the money I would definitely stay somewhere else. The next day on check out the receptionist barely said anything to us didnt even ask us if we enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel,you will not be dissappointed!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night over Christmas. Got a huge room on the fifth floor including breakfast for €79 for the two of us. The hotel was exceptionally quiet. We had bar food and it was lovely. The breakfast service was nice as well. There is loads of free parking at the front of the hotel. Close enough to the M3/M50 as well. I would stay here again no hesitation when it is off peak. At peak times, it can have rough clientele in it. Some of the wedding parties, I've witnessed look like they could cause lots of trouble. No bouncers visible on the doors either. That's a mistake that they could live to regret
reviews.title: Lovely when it's quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: just back from one night in the Carlton Hotel, Blanchardstown, I got it at a good price so not to upset
reviews.title: if it was a Budget Hotel it would be ok

reviews.text: our works Christmas party the bar is well stocked with drink and staff and waiting staff however the food was poor - fatty and near cold ( now I dont expect a lot on this kind of night ) so that taken our room was as warm as the food - bed was lumpy - paint falling off the ceiling - with only one small shampoo and gel it was not enough - but the worst was when I booked this night 3 months ago for 3 db rooms I got a deal on a site that included breakfast so after filling in all the forms they ask, to be told by the girl behind the counter that we could book breakfast for 12 euro each - when i pointed out we had that included in the price she tapped away on her pc and looked up right in my face and said "No" so it was just as well I had printed my confirmation x3 and after digging out of my wife's bag I gave it to her and calm as you like she just said " ok "
reviews.title: Resturant was total let down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cant help feel I was been taken for a ride
reviews.title: Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: breakfast was very poor - rashers were cold and as much fat on it as the turkey the night before - sausages were cool but ok - but the scrambled eggs were cool and tasteless - on the up side the toast was nice.
reviews.title: Nice hotel shame about breakfast

reviews.text: I've just stayed in this hotel where I found the staff to be among the friendliest of people I have come across in a hotel . They couldn't do enough for you . The only let down was there is no residence bar which would have been nice as we were staying for a dancing competition and it was late when we finished for the night. Also the breakfast on the sunday morning was very poor as they ran out of food and were slow bringing more. But overall it was a great stay the rooms were very comfortable and stylish with ice makers on the corridors.
reviews.title: friendliness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my husband and I stayed here for 1 night recently. Check-in was smooth, the room was a good size, the bathroom was clean, both are showing some signs of wear. We ate in the bar the evening of arrival--food was very good, a small menu but enough choices, reasonable value. This hotel is approx 20 minutes by car from the blancherstown shopping centre, there is a bus stop outside but a car is necessay. We did not eat breakfast there as we were leaving early. We had a special deal so was very good value. would stay again.
reviews.title: nice hotel car essential

reviews.text: Modern hotel, lovely rooms, excellent staff, good food. Family friendly, within driving distance of Dublin city centre, bus service nearby also. A swimming pool would be good. Otherwise, all good.
reviews.title: Very smart hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel for the weekend.The room was lovely! large and spotless Staff friendly and helpful.The food was excellent.Very good value.Special offers available
reviews.title: great weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here recently and it was a very good experience. The hotel was typical four star; bedrooms very nice, modern and all facilities you would expect. The staff were very friendly and helpful which added to the whole experience. As we stayed with AXA Leisure for €39pp for B & B this was exceptional value. Breakfast was very good; nice selection to suit everyone tastes despite the rock hard black & white puddings.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel - location not so good

description: Carlton Hotel Blanchardstown is located in the heart of Dublin 15, within short distance of the Blanchardstown, Ballycoolin and Damastown corporate parks and in close proximity to the National Aquatic Centre, Blanchardstown Shopping Centre and Fairyhouse Racecourse. Locatred only 10 mins from Dublin Airport and Under 20 Mins from Dublin City Centre, Also close to the M50 for all major routes running to the north, south and west of the country as well as the entire east coast of Ireland, the Carlton Blanchardstown is easily accessible. Furthermore, its close proximity to the capital opens up vibrant opportunities for theatre trips, museums, concerts and the buzzing nightlife for which Dublin is famous.
